image.altText: Rohan Dennis walking outside court.

props.synopsis: Former world champion cyclist Rohan Dennis has been handed a two-year suspended sentence over the death of his Olympian wife, Melissa Hoskins, in Adelaide's District Court this morning. Follow live.Â

title.children: Rohan Dennis given suspended sentence over death of Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: A beach along the Great Australian Bight.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the deaths of two women aged in their 60s whose bodies were recovered from the water after a search on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Bodies of two women recovered after search off Streaky Bay

image.altText: An aerial view of the pellet plant at the Whyalla steelworks

props.synopsis: Amid ongoing legal action to wrest control of the Whyalla port from former steelworks owner GFG Alliance, the state government has moved to clarify the facility's ownership.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks port ownership dispute triggers law change

image.altText: Jo smiles while nealing beside black labrador leroy, both looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A dog trainer has successfully taught her dog to detect footrot in sheep, an innovative process that could help streamline footrot detection if implemented on farms.

title.children: Leroy the Labrador trained to sniff out a rotten disease

image.altText: Broken Hill court on a clear sunny day.

props.synopsis: A Broken Hill man's lawyer will apply for his animal cruelty charges to be dismissed due to possible mental health issues or cognitive impairment.

title.children: Man pleads guilty to animal cruelty but may avoid criminal conviction

image.altText: Man in hospital bed in blue gown, broken leg on the bed

props.synopsis:
SA Health apologises to a man who spent nine days waiting for surgery at the Royal Adelaide Hospital after shattering his leg in a football game.

Â

title.children: Footballer with broken leg waits nine days in hospital for surgery

image.altText: A bald man with a brown goatie standing in front of a window

props.synopsis: The brother of an Australian man whose body was found at a beach on the island of Phuket says he appears to have run into trouble while swimming.

title.children: Australian man's death in Thailand likely a 'terrible accident'

image.altText: Tammy Franks looking stern in a pink blazer in front of microphones

props.synopsis: South Australian Greens politician Tammy Franks says she's resigning from the party and will sit as an independent until the next election.

title.children: SA Greens MP Tammy Franks resigns from party

image.altText: A graphic of a man charging an EV on a power pole with a colour treatment drawing attention

props.synopsis: A lack of charging infrastructure across the country is often cited as a barrier to the transition to electric vehicles. But soon, EV charging could be a simple as finding a car park.

title.children: Thousands of power poles make the potential for EV charging limitless

image.altText: A river channel cutting through greenery, sun reflecting on the water.

props.synopsis: Just add water to the Channel Country and watch it spring to life. It's a silver lining of recent devastating flooding in the outback.

title.children: Floods transform Channel Country into pelican paradise

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: The South Australian government invited some of the nation's top media and business executives to enjoy corporate hospitality at this yearâs LIV Golf tournament, prompting questions about use of taxpayer funds.

title.children: FOI documents reveal 'boys club' guest list for exclusive LIV Golf suite

image.altText: A young boy site in a pram-like mobility aid

props.synopsis: A mother and her son with a disability waited two hours for an access taxi before a Good Samaritan drove them to an Adelaide hospital.

title.children: Truck driver picks up mother and son who waited hours for access taxi

image.altText: An overpass going over a tunnel

props.synopsis: South Road was once the gateway to Adelaide's car industry, filtering hundreds of manufacturing workers into a suburban factory. But when that closed, the landscape changed. Now it's undergoing its biggest transformation yet.

title.children: A $15b road project is reshaping Adelaide's suburbs â will it be worth the price tag?

image.altText: A woman talks with reporters.

props.synopsis: Is Labor's historic majority a big enough vote of confidence to allow it to take "bold" decisions on treaty and truth-telling? These Indigenous leaders think so.

title.children: 'They have the numbers': Government urged to pass truth and treaty bill

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit at a construction site

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is jetting to Indonesia for his first trip since his thumping re-election win. Follow live.

image.altText: A sketch of Casandra Ventura holding up one hand in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs's former girlfriend gives evidence at his criminal trial, telling jurors she felt she had no choice but to participate in the "freak-off" sex parties central to the case.

title.children: Singer Cassie questioned about sex 'freak-offs' at Diddy's trial

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market trades lower despite a mostly positive session on Wall Street, US inflation rises less than expected despite Donald Trump's global tariffs, while ASIC takes action against Macquarie for the fourth time in 12 months. Follow live.

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASIC suing Macquarie for misleading 'short sales' conduct over 14 years

props.synopsis: Trump has just signed an order that could hike drug prices around the world and he will soon announce pharmaceutical tariffs. What does all this mean for the price of medication here?

title.children: Trump's pharmaceutical 'tariff wall' is coming â is Australia ready?

image.altText: A woman speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, who did not run for deputy Liberal leader after Angus Taylor lost the leadership ballot, says Mr Taylor should be on winner Sussan Ley's frontbench.

title.children: Ley to go slow on shadow cabinet with Nationals stoush first on agenda

image.altText: One man smiles and another maintains a neutral expression as they look in front of where they stand

image.altText: Soldiers dressed in fatigues walk across the snow covered ground of a forest.

props.synopsis: Finland has long been a nation of preppers, thanks in part to its close proximity to Russia. So could its self-sufficiency be a role model for other nations, including Australia?

title.children: Could Finland's prepper mindset be a role model for Australia?

image.altText: Trish and Bernie pictured in a house together

props.synopsis: Two women abused by a paedophile priest in the 1970s are pursuing the Catholic Church for compensation, but a High Court decision has put their case in jeopardy.

title.children: As children, these sisters didn't know they had the same abuser

image.altText: President Donald Trump arrives on Air Force One at Palm Beach International Airport, Friday, March 28

props.synopsis: A $400 million plane gifted from the Qatari royal family could be the next Air Force One aircraft responsible for transporting the president of the United States.

title.children: Why is a foreign country gifting the White House a plane?

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses and multiple pieces of jewellery looks down.

props.synopsis: The reality TV star and businesswoman tells a Paris court she thought she was going to die during a 2016 robbery in her hotel room during the city's fashion week celebration, and that the incident changed her life forever.

title.children: Key takeaways from the night that changed Kim Kardashian's life 'forever'

image.altText: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman speaks to the media during a press conference

props.synopsis: NSW Opposition Leader Mark Speakman takes aim at a prominent anti-abortion campaigner who threatened his leadership in an email this week.

title.children: NSW opposition leader in state of 'shock' over abortion debate tactics

image.altText: Rows of antennas seen at sunset.

props.synopsis: Canada's decision to turn to Australia for help in beefing up its defence of the Arctic has raised eyebrows in the defence industry.

title.children: Canada has turned to Australia as its relationship with the US crumbles

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication playing out in Australian pharmacies

image.altText: A solar system installer adjusts solar panels on the roof of a house.

props.synopsis: Up-front costs are a hurdle to many households making energy-efficient upgrades to their homes, a report suggests, but confusion is also a major deterrent.

title.children: Half of households prepared to spend $8,000 on energy upgrades

image.altText: Trump walking down some plane stairs to meet the Saudi Crown Prince.

props.synopsis: The US president says he believes the ties between the United States and Saudi Arabia are "more powerful than ever before".

title.children: Trump signs US-Saudi arms deal as officials talk up prospect of ceasefire in Gaza

title.children: Unions turn on Minns government with attack ads over mental health compo

image.altText: A young exasperated woman wearing glasses gesturing at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Has the simple search become less useful in a world of low-information, SEO-optimised sites, and often faulty AI summaries? Are there better ways to navigate the web?

title.children: Is Google search getting worse? Maybe what we want from it has changed

image.altText: A woman wearing a figure hugging short dress with tassels and long leather boots on stage in front of crowd

title.children: This is who is going through to the Eurovision grand final from the first semifinal

image.altText: Rory McIlroy holds up the Stonehaven Cup after winning the 2013 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Newly minted career grand slam winner Rory McIlroy will play the Australian Open for the first time in 11 years in December, and back up in 2026.

title.children: Masters champ McIlroy returning to Australia after more than a decade

image.altText: Bradley Wiggins wins men's time trial

props.synopsis: Sir Bradley Wiggins reveals how he became a functioning cocaine addict after he had called time on his cycling career.
